page.title: 05HOSPITALS-GLENFIELD
page.content: {GLENFIELD GENERAL HOSPITAL}was opened on the 7th October 1984. 350 people are employed at the hospital which has an intensive therapy unit, 7 wards and 240 beds. There is no casualty department and only people over the age of 14 can be admitted.An extension is planned that will take another 250 patients and includes a maternity unit { {GLENFIELD COMMUNITY HOSPITAL}was opened in 1977,when Hillcrest Hospital closed. It is a geriatric hospital for people over 65, with 6 wards,168 beds and employing 100 staff. It caters for short stay and long stay patients. { {GLENFRITH HOSPITAL}can accommodate 400 mentally disabled patients. 15 out of the 200 children at The Hall Primary School, Glenfield have parents working at the hospital complex.
